messages: f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (23:06): but the bot isn't here
38ced805a9bc0b0aeec522d21f376b73 (23:47): How do I delete the content of a div element?
1e6235e02c4e660245795d019cc22870 (23:51): salah: remove all of its child nodes

38ced805a9bc0b0aeec522d21f376b73 (00:09): tobie_, well I use Ajax to print out an element to a div box, which works perfectly. so the button to empty the div box is in the file deleter.py, but the div box in it self is at default.py
38ced805a9bc0b0aeec522d21f376b73 (00:09): how do I remove the div box over a file?
38ced805a9bc0b0aeec522d21f376b73 (00:09): like deleting a div box in default.py from deleter.py

e5b65509fa8e8a2a91a35298fad08b68 (00:10): hi... i have a problem with IE here, maybe someone can help. I have a <div> A, to which I add further <div>s B. with A.innerHTML +=... . To remove one of those 'B' divs again, I just make its content empty (B.innerHTML = ''). Firefox reflows the page correctly, while IE leaves a huge gap where the former content of the B-div has been. is there any workaround?
e5b65509fa8e8a2a91a35298fad08b68 (00:18): my god, no, thanks, i'll stay with innerHTML :)
5e22a39ccf920b270a88def51d3be172 (00:22): just done user innerHTML on a <p> in IE O.o
